Main menu settings
The configuration of the composition and order of
main menu
items can be set by an administrator through the side menu.
Each user can personalize the
display
of configured items according to their needs.
Menu Settings
Managing the main menu items is available in the
menu customization mode
, accessed by clicking the
button located at the bottom of the panel.
If the user has the "Run"
permission
for "Configuring the side menu", they can edit the
content
and the
order
of the menu items for all users, as well as control the visibility of items for their personal needs.
A user without the mentioned permission in menu settings mode can only configure the
visibility
of menu items.
Creating a menu item
A menu item can be created by clicking the corresponding button, which will display a modal window, where the user can select the new menu item type according to the data to which quick access is required:
FAQ
- displaying the frequently asked questions registry;
Widget
- displaying a widget in the main menu (for more details, see
"Setting up a widget in the main menu"
);
Dashboard
- configured
dashboard
;
Kanban board
- configured
kanban board
;
Object profile
- displaying the visual of a specific object;
Report
- displaying a reported form;
Folder
- a menu item representing a top-level name. This setting is not a full-fledged menu item and is used to reveal a lower-level list;
Custom form
- displaying a custom visual defined by the object ID;
Registry
-
object registry
of the specified type.
Creating menu items is available to users with the
permission
to create instances of the corresponding object type.
After selecting the type, the corresponding configuration parameters should be specified:
Setting
Purpose
Main
Name
Inputting a menu item name to be displayed in the navigation panel.
Identifier
Inputting an attribute identifier (the name of the field for the database table). The field can be filled in automatically.
Order
Determining an ordinal number of the created menu item. If a parent item is specified, the order will be set within the subsection. The field can be filled in automatically.
Icon
Selecting an icon for the configured menu item from the dropdown list. Some options can be viewed on the
"Menu settings icons"
page.
Expanded by default
Logical attribute defining the menu item representation.
Parent menu item
Selecting a parent menu item. This means the configured menu item will be a subitem (subsection) for the parent menu item.
Report form
Selecting a report form to be displayed. After selecting the configured menu item, the System will display the selected type of report form.
This setting is available when the "Report" menu item type is selected.
Dashboard
Defining a dashboard to be displayed. After selecting the configured menu item, the System will display the specified dashboard.
This setting is available when the "Dashboard" menu item type is selected.
Object type for display
Defining an object type to be displayed. After selecting the configured menu item, the System will display a registry of objects of the selected type.
The full list of types in the parameter’s drop-down list becomes available after clicking the "Show all types" button
. This button is displayed if the user has the "Run" permission for
"View system types in the "Object type" registry"
.
This setting is available when the "Registry" or the "Object" menu item type is selected, and the "Manual" option is set for object definition.
Registry
Selecting
basic registry
of the object type specified above (for more details, see
“Visual”
).
If the field is filled in and the user has
permissions
to the specified basic registry, then:
if the user has selected a different
basic registry
or a child of it by default, the basic registry specified in the “Registry” field will be displayed;
if the user has selected
custom registry
by default, a child of the one specified in the “Registry” field - the default custom registry will be displayed.
If the user does not have
permissions
to the basic registry specified in the “Registry” field or the “Registry” field is not filled in, the default registry will be displayed.
This setting is available when the "Registry" menu item type is selected.
Define object
Selecting a method of object definition. Possible options:
Algorithm;
Manually.
This setting is available when the "Object" menu item type is selected.
Object type instance
Defining an instance of the selected object type for display.
This setting is available when the "Object" menu item type is selected, and the "Manually" option is set for object definition.
Object type visual
Defining a visual for the selected object type instance.
This setting is available when the "Object" menu item type is selected, and the "Manually" option is set for object definition.
Object detection algorithm
Defining an algorithm for assigning the object to be displayed. The algorithm must return an object (reference value); for this,
return
and
dict
functions are used.
This setting is available when the "Object" menu item type is selected, and the "Algorithm" option is set for object definition.
Algorithm to determine visual
Defining an algorithm for configuring the visual (find more details in
"Visual by algorithm"
).
This setting is available when the "Object" menu item type is selected, and the "Algorithm" option is ser for object definition.
Widget
Selecting a widget. Possible options:
Text
;
External frame
This setting is available when the "Widget" menu item type is selected.
Kanban board
Defining a
Kanban board
for display.
The selection is made via a dropdown list. Creating a new Kanban board or editing the selected one is possible through the action menu of the parameter.
This setting is available when the "Kanban board" menu item type is selected.
Additional
Module ID
Identifying an object the profile of which must be displayed in the main menu.
Editing the menu composition
When hovering the cursor over a menu item, the following options are available:
Modifying an item by clicking the
button followed by selecting an action:
Edit – similar to creating a new item, the item configuration parameters will be displayed in the current window;
Hide/Show for myself – configuring the
visibility
of the menu item (applies only to the user performing the configuration);
Delete – removing the item from the main menu;
When selecting an action, a modal window will open to choose the deletion method or cancel the action.
Managing the order of menu item placement, including nesting, by clicking
and dragging (Drag&Drop) the item:
Hiding and restoring visibility of menu items by dragging between the main section and the "Hidden Menu Items" section using Drag&Drop is not supported.
The visibility of items in users' main menus is controlled by the "Read" permission for each item.
Access to the content of a menu item is determined by the presence of appropriate permissions.
Item Visibility
Each user can manage the visibility of the main menu composition
configured
by the administrator.
To do this, navigate to customization mode by clicking the
button, after which hovering the mouse cursor over a menu item will reveal the hide option
.
Hiding a selected menu item also hides all its nested items.
When hidden, the item is moved from the main menu composition to the "Hidden menu items" section, where visibility restoration is available by clicking the
icon.
The "Hidden Menu Items" section is displayed only in edit mode if there is at least one hidden item.
Clicking the
button located next to the
menu view
selection buttons allows resetting the menu display to the administrator’s configuration.
Clicking the button opens a modal window to confirm the action.
